data.title: Just OK
data.text: We tried today based on good reviews we read in yelp. Restaurant ambience is more like a donut shop in my opinion, may be a lot of people order for to go. Portion is average, just ok. Taste just meh, we ordered chicken teriyaki rice bowl, pad kee maw, and yakisoba. The good thing were we got free california roll for check in via yelp, and also the server was very friendly and informative. For the price around $7.95, there are other places that give more and taste better.

data.title: Good quick food
data.text: I have been there a number of times and finally decided to try delivery.  I ordered on the website which was easy and had pictures of the food for anyone that doesn't know what it looks like.  I had the Korean Bulgogi Bowl, and a Sushi Rainbow Roll.  Both showed up fresh and looking good.  The Korean bowl even came with a side of Kimchi.  The Sushi tasted nice and fresh and the bowl was nice and satisfying, although be careful ordering spice level 3 or above since it does tend to get a little "warm".  And on a final note the person that delivered it was very nice and professional and actually seemed like he enjoyed his job.

data.title: Tiger tantalizes tongue
data.text: This is a hole in the wall restaurant in a strip center on the main East/West road through Allen. The food is good, but the only atmosphere is the one you breathe.  Today my wife had fried rice (which she liked) and I had the Pho noodle bowl with chicken (which I liked).  A pretty good lunch choice if you want simple Asian fare.

data.title: Great Variety
data.text: We've been here a few times and always enjoy the food.  They have lots of different dishes from Pho to Sushi to stir-fry. It always tastes great, but we think it's a little pricey for what you get. The atmosphere is nothing special, just a typical diner. The service is pretty quick.

data.title: Awesome for takeout
data.text:
Thai /Asian food does not generally travel well - take outs are usually a disaster because the heat and moisture completely ruins the texture of rice / noodles that you generally order . I don't know what this place does - or its something to do with the way they pack their food - it tastes awesome even after a 20-30 mins drive home 
I have ordered many times from his place - Thai basil rice, curry fried rice , pad Thai, pad ki mao, - all are good 
The only criticism is the portion size- it's tiny, each rice bowl or curry bowl barely is enough for one person . So .. Order more than you normally do !!!

data.title: Bad experience
data.text: I've seen this place, but had never gone in, so this place is close to our house, and we were walking in the neighborhood, so I suggested we try it.  The first clue that this wasn't going to go well was the place was completely empty on a Saturday, and we were there a good 10 minutes before anyone came in behind us.  The 40 minutes we were there, I'd say about 5 other people came through.  My wife and I ordered the beef terryaki bowl, and we both commented that it would've been good to actually see pictures of the different dishes.  My point of reference would be Genghis Grill where you can see what you're getting.  My wife also ordered sushi, which the guy advised was brought in from a different restaurant?  So, our food came pretty quickly, but the portion seemed really small based on what I paid.  Again for reference I could've paid $20 at Genghis Grill for 2 drinks, 2 bowls, and ice cream.  I paid roughly $40 for 2 bowls, 1 drink, and sushi.  I made quick work of my beef terryaki bowl, but my wife and I both noticed there was a ton of sauce once I got to the bottom, so I was worried they'd use the sauce to mask something.  My worries were justified the next morning when I woke up with stomach cramps.  My wife argued it couldn't have been the food because she didn't have the same symptoms, but she had eaten the sushi and took her terryaki bowl to go.  She ate her terryaki bowl a few hours after me, so sure enough her symptoms kicked in a few hours after mine.  Avoid this place, there are better options.

data.title: A little bit of everything!
data.text:
You go up to the counter and order your meal. They have plenty of seats available. Menu is a variation of Thai, Chinese, Korean, Japanese, and Vietnamese food. A little bit of everything. They have a kid menu too. 
For those who love Boba tea they have quite a good selection. Their boba is soft and chewy. I am kind of disappointed of the tea that I ordered. I felt like it was watered down. Maybe because I ordered it less sweet. Will try the normal sweetness. 
However, their noodle dish is DA BOMB. We had pad kee mow. The taste is super authentic!! 
Would definitely come back here to try more dishes. 
Service is excellent and price is very reasonable.

data.title: Best place ever.
data.text: The food is wonderful and the owner is great. I first had it when it was catered at work, but we have been going there ever since.

data.title: Unique food options in Allen, Texas
data.text: I visited for lunch and had the Pho soup bowl with chicken. The broth was delicious. The meal was filling at the time, but two hours later I was hungry. I will definitely go back as their menu offers many options to try flavors and sauces that I am not familiar with. The seating area was clean, They may want to invest in some blinds at some point as a hot blinding sun was coming through the windows. Service was friendly and efficient.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: I requested a rice soup bowl with vegetables and chicken. I thought the soup bowl was very delicious and cooked well to my expectations. I would highly recommend this place if you're going to be in this area!!!
